page.title: 03Colden Common:Landscape 2.
page.content: The Chalk area is characterized by an absence of surface drainage.However,it is well dissected by a number of dry valleys,chief of which is that containing the hamlet of Hensting.This relatively steep-sided valley carries one of the roads leading to Owslebury. The Tertiary area in the southern half of the block,although mainly clay, carries only one major stream -Bow Lake -which is a tributary of the River Itchen.There is map evidence that the stream was dammed in medieval times to produce fish ponds south of the present hamlet of Fishers Pond.The existing lake at this settlement,now used for recreational fishing,has the same origin.It is fed by chalk springs in the Hensting valley
